questions.question: Neither of them ...................... hard.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after either and neither.

questions.question: One of the boys .................... missing.
questions.description: Use a singular verb after one of.

questions.question: The stars as well as the moon ...................... us light.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former in number and person.

questions.question: He asked ....................... we had had our lunch.
questions.description: We use if or whether to report a question.

questions.question: The council ..................... of ten members.
questions.description: Council is a collective noun collective nouns are usually considered as singular and take singular verbs.

questions.question: He knows ........................ swim.
questions.description: Know is followed by how to.

questions.question: You must ..................... your teacher's advice.
questions.description: You can hear something without wanting to. To listen is to pay attention. Use listen to before an object.

questions.question: Six thousand francs ....................... not much to Roucolle.
questions.description: When we talk about a sum of money, we usually use a singular verb with it.

questions.question: He was here a moment ........................
questions.description: Ago is used to count back from now. Before is used to count back from a point of time in the past.

questions.question: He ........................ for the last ten months.
questions.description: To talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, use the present perfect or present perfect continuous tense.

questions.question: He is elder ...................... me.
questions.description: Use than after older and to after elder.
